intro: Aspidostemon antongilensis, commonly known as the Antongil's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces a milky sap, which is a common trait among members of its family. Aspidostemon antongilensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
